intro: Ficus guapoi, commonly known as the Guapoi fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers that develop into edible fig fruits. Ficus guapoi thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
